Avoid ambigious features. Is a Banana ripe, who says so?
Careful when something is truly random generated, Atmospheric Change, Earthquakes, Stocks. Very difficult, if not impossible to predict.
MNIST performance when tilting Images, of adding noise.

Need to carefully balance your objective, with what the Model Type actually does and be explicitly clear on Goal. What are you actually attempting to calculate when maximizing or minimizing, what is prioritized, Training Performance, or ability to Generalize.  Strive to avoid overfitting, maximize ability to Generalize.
Is your Data Structured in a way that is conducive to your Model.
Any data set can be optimized, even when there is NO relation. It will generalize.

An Example of this would a classification model with Wolves and Dogs,  many wolf photos happened to be taken in snowy environments, while dog photos were often taken indoors or on grass. The model learned to detect snow, not animals.

Models will cheat and can solve problems which appear to be optimal, but they might not be solving what you expect or require, they might be finding patterns in the data which you do not see.
